SEARCH
Package state

Class StateTracker

java.lang.Object
state.StateTracker
public class StateTracker extends Object
Tracks the state of a quantum system's qubits as a column vector stored in a ComplexSparse of nx1 dimensions, where n is 2 to the power of the number of qubits. This state vector is used to determine the system state after applying quantum gates.
Since:
6 August 2024
Version:
0.3
Author:
Robert Smith

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    StateTracker()
    Default constructor initializes the system state with one qubit set to |0⟩ state (1+0i).
    StateTracker(int numQubits)
    Parameterized constructor initializes the system state with the specified number of qubits, setting all qubits to the |0⟩ state.
    StateTracker(ComplexSparse matrix)
    Constructor that initializes the state tracker with a given state vector.

    ComplexSparse

    Retrieves the current state vector as a column vector in a ComplexSparse of n x 1, where n is 2 to the power of N, and N is the number of qubits in the system.

    Returns the size of the state vector, which is 2^n where n is the number of qubits.

  • Constructor Details

    • StateTracker

      public StateTracker()
      Default constructor initializes the system state with one qubit set to |0⟩ state (1+0i).

    • StateTracker

      public StateTracker(int numQubits)
      Parameterized constructor initializes the system state with the specified number of qubits, setting all qubits to the |0⟩ state.
      Parameters:
      numQubits - the number of qubits to set up the system with

    • StateTracker

      public StateTracker(ComplexSparse matrix)
      Constructor that initializes the state tracker with a given state vector.
      Parameters:
      matrix - the ComplexSparse matrix representing the initial state vector

  • Method Details

    • makeClone

      public StateTracker makeClone()
      Creates and returns a deep copy of the current StateTracker.
      Returns:
      a new StateTracker instance with the same state as the current one

    • getStateVec

      public ComplexSparse getStateVec()
      Retrieves the current state vector as a column vector in a ComplexSparse of n x 1, where n is 2 to the power of N, and N is the number of qubits in the system.
      Returns:
      the current state vector as a ComplexSparse in column vector format

    • getStateVecSize

      public int getStateVecSize()
      Returns the size of the state vector, which is 2^n where n is the number of qubits.
      Returns:
      the number of rows in the state vector

    • setStateVec

      public boolean setStateVec(ComplexSparse newState)
      Sets a new state vector for the quantum system.
      Parameters:
      newState - the new column vector to assign to the system state
      Returns:
      true if setting the new state vector was successful, false otherwise

    • getQubitCount

      public int getQubitCount()
      Calculates and returns the number of qubits in the system based on the size of the state vector.
      Returns:
      the number of qubits in the quantum system

    • stateVectorToQubits

      public ComplexSparse stateVectorToQubits()
      Converts the quantum state vector to individual qubit probabilities.

      This method calculates the probability of each qubit being in the |0⟩ or |1⟩ state, handling superposition states and complex amplitudes.

      Returns:
      A ComplexSparse of size (numQubits x 2) containing the probabilities for each qubit's |0⟩ and |1⟩ states
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the state vector dimensions are invalid

    • get

      public ComplexNumber get(int row, int column)
      Retrieves the ComplexNumber at the specified position in the state vector.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index (0-based) in the state vector
      column - the column index (usually 0 for state vectors)
      Returns:
      the ComplexNumber at the specified position
